intro: Clematoclethra guizhouensis, commonly known as the Guizhou clethra, is a rare evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within mountainous regions. Its botanical features include small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
